intro: Triantha occidentalis subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western triantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant features slender, grass-like stems and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical structure is adapted to its alpine or subalpine habitat, with short growth cycles to cope with harsh environmental conditions.
